</span><!-- -->After submitting all the necessary documents required for the scholarship opportunity and after having an online interview with the sponsors of<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=isi&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205269990558588928"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>iSI</span></a><!-- -->, fortunately, I was selected as a beneficiary of the<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=ischolar2024&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205269990558588928"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>iScholar2024</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>scholarship award.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->I am excited and grateful to this initiative. I see myself in the PG school already.<!-- --><span>

</span><!-- -->Luckily, I came across<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/i-scholar-initiative/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->i-Scholar Initiative (iSI)<!-- --></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>on LinkedIn and I applied for their impeccable GRE scholarship offer.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->After submitting all the necessary documents required for the scholarship opportunity and after having an online interview with the sponsors of<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=isi&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205269990558588928"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>iSI</span></a><!-- -->, fortunately, I was selected as a beneficiary of the<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=ischolar2024&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205269990558588928"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>iScholar2024</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>scholarship award.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->I am excited and grateful to this initiative. I see myself in the PG school already.<!-- --><span>

<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Hello, all. Dr. Mallik will be joining as an assistant professor in the Department of Computer and Information Sciences (CIS) at Towson University - a research active public institution in Maryland, USA, in Fall-2024. Currently, there are two openings of fully funded PhD positions in his lab, with a research focus on energy-efficient infrastructure for sustainable AI.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>

<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Hello, all. Dr. Mallik will be joining as an assistant professor in the Department of Computer and Information Sciences (CIS) at Towson University - a research active public institution in Maryland, USA, in Fall-2024. Currently, there are two openings of fully funded PhD positions in his lab, with a research focus on energy-efficient infrastructure for sustainable AI.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Interested and highly motivated applicants can email him along with their CVs (two pages max, consisting of but not limited to their academic and test scores, github and google scholar links, research experience, publications, and technical skillset) at<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="mailto:amallik@charlotte.edu" target="_self"><!-- -->amallik@charlotte.edu<!-- --></a><!-- -->.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Recruited students are scheduled to start their doctoral study and research in Spring-2025. </span><!-- -->1. Applicants should meet the minimum admission requirememts set by the graduate school and the Dept of CIS at TU.<!-- --><span>

</span><!-- -->Three (3) fully funded<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205213102487859200"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>positions and multiple research assistants<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=ra&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205213102487859200"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>RA</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>/<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=intern&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205213102487859200"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>intern</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>positions are available at the Networked Control Systems (NetCoS) Group, at The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou)<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/hkustguangzhou/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->HKUST Guangzhou<!-- --></span></span></a><!-- -->.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Successful candidates will have the chance to contribute to cutting-edge research on the design and analysis of networked control systems integrating concepts from distributed optimization, networked control theory, machine learning, and privacy preservation, with potential applications in various domains such as smart grids, cyber-physical systems, Internet of Things, and cooperative robotics.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>

<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Embarking on my<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205206566550044673"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>Journey at RPI!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Back in 2020, I started my journey in chemical engineering with the hope of entering the research field. As each day passed, my passion for this field grew stronger and more intense. Today, I am proud to share that I have successfully completed my bachelor's degree. But the journey doesn‚Äôt end here‚Äîit‚Äôs just the beginning of an exciting new chapter. I am excited to share that I have been offered fully funded PhD positions at both the University of Houston and<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/rensselaer-polytechnic-institute/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute<!-- --></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>(RPI). After much contemplation and excitement, I am overjoyed to continue my journey at RPI in the¬†Chemical and Biological Engineering Department.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->This achievement is not mine alone. It is a testament to the unwavering support of my friends, teammates, and mentors of the<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/ACoAADc3OzYBltEbNn0H_J2UKmqV3YRzsI4IJLs" target="_self"><span><a class="ember-view" href="/in/thop-verse-89a2a321a/" id="ember625"><!-- -->THOP VERSE<!-- --></a></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>team, who stood by me through every high and low. They have been my backbone, providing the strength, encouragement, and wisdom I needed to reach this point.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->As I prepare to step into this new adventure, I am filled with gratitude and anticipation. The road ahead will undoubtedly be challenging, but I am ready to embrace it with open arms. <!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Embarking on my<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205206566550044673"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>Journey at RPI!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Back in 2020, I started my journey in chemical engineering with the hope of entering the research field. As each day passed, my passion for this field grew stronger and more intense. Today, I am proud to share that I have successfully completed my bachelor's degree. But the journey doesn‚Äôt end here‚Äîit‚Äôs just the beginning of an exciting new chapter. I am excited to share that I have been offered fully funded PhD positions at both the University of Houston and<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/rensselaer-polytechnic-institute/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute<!-- --></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>(RPI). They have been my backbone, providing the strength, encouragement, and wisdom I needed to reach this point.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->As I prepare to step into this new adventure, I am filled with gratitude and anticipation. The road ahead will undoubtedly be challenging, but I am ready to embrace it with open arms. <!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->University of Campania Luigi Vanvitelli Call for Applications: 40th Cycle Research Doctoral Courses by<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/universityofcampanialuigivanvitelli-/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->University of Campania "Luigi Vanvitelli"<span class="white-space-pre"> </span></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>

</span><!-- -->- Reserved Scholarships: Available for candidates with international protection status.<!-- --><span>

<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Embarking on my<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205206566550044673"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>Journey at RPI!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Back in 2020, I started my journey in chemical engineering with the hope of entering the research field. As each day passed, my passion for this field grew stronger and more intense. Today, I am proud to share that I have successfully completed my bachelor's degree. But the journey doesn‚Äôt end here‚Äîit‚Äôs just the beginning of an exciting new chapter. I am excited to share that I have been offered fully funded PhD positions at both the University of Houston and<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/rensselaer-polytechnic-institute/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute<!-- --></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>(RPI). After much contemplation and excitement, I am overjoyed to continue my journey at RPI in the¬†Chemical and Biological Engineering Department.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->This achievement is not mine alone. They have been my backbone, providing the strength, encouragement, and wisdom I needed to reach this point.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>

<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Embarking on my<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205206566550044673"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>Journey at RPI!<!-- --><span>

<span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=iscolar2024&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205269990558588928"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>iScolar2024</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>Awardee<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Till now, I haven't lost my early hope, that wisdom is to be found in a book as easily as a fish can be found in the sea. I desire wisdom as keenly as Solomon, but this wisdom must be as genuine as my mother's tears!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->As an award-winning First-class graduate of the department of Chemistry, University of Ibadan, one of my goals for 2024/2025 is to pursue a postgraduate study in Computational Chemistry, preferably in the US or UK.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->However, one major requirement, which also offers a competitive advantage in getting a funded PhD opportunity in a renowned institution in the US is taking the GRE, which comes with a cost that I may not be able to afford.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Luckily, I came across<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/i-scholar-initiative/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->i-Scholar Initiative (iSI)<!-- --></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>on LinkedIn and I applied for their impeccable GRE scholarship offer.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->After submitting all the necessary documents required for the scholarship opportunity and after having an online interview with the sponsors of<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=isi&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205269990558588928"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>iSI</span></a><!-- -->, fortunately, I was selected as a beneficiary of the<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=ischolar2024&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205269990558588928"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>iScholar2024</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>scholarship award.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->I am excited and grateful to this initiative. I see myself in the PG school already.<!-- --><span>

<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->üî∞ ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêûùê¨ùê≠ùêûùêù ùê≠ùê® ùê†ùêûùê≠ ùêüùêÆùê•ùê•ùê≤ ùêüùêÆùêßùêùùêûùêù ùêèùê°ùêÉ ùê®ùêüùêüùêûùê´?<!-- --><span>

<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Embarking on my<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205206566550044673"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>Journey at RPI!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Back in 2020, I started my journey in chemical engineering with the hope of entering the research field. As each day passed, my passion for this field grew stronger and more intense. Today, I am proud to share that I have successfully completed my bachelor's degree. But the journey doesn‚Äôt end here‚Äîit‚Äôs just the beginning of an exciting new chapter. I am excited to share that I have been offered fully funded PhD positions at both the University of Houston and<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/rensselaer-polytechnic-institute/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute<!-- --></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>(RPI). After much contemplation and excitement, I am overjoyed to continue my journey at RPI in the¬†Chemical and Biological Engineering Department.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->This achievement is not mine alone. It is a testament to the unwavering support of my friends, teammates, and mentors of the<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/ACoAADc3OzYBltEbNn0H_J2UKmqV3YRzsI4IJLs" target="_self"><span><a class="ember-view" href="/in/thop-verse-89a2a321a/" id="ember625"><!-- -->THOP VERSE<!-- --></a></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>team, who stood by me through every high and low. They have been my backbone, providing the strength, encouragement, and wisdom I needed to reach this point.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->As I prepare to step into this new adventure, I am filled with gratitude and anticipation. The road ahead will undoubtedly be challenging, but I am ready to embrace it with open arms. Here‚Äôs to new beginnings, groundbreaking research, and making dreams a reality at RPI!<!-- --><span>

<span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Education and Mental Health: PhD Opportunity in Economics at Royal Holloway<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Fully funded PhD opportunity at¬†Royal Holloway, University of London¬†available from September<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->About three children in every classroom in the UK have a diagnosable mental health problem. Risk factors range from genetic, to psychological and environmental elements. This project will focus on the causal links between school environment and mental health. Due to the heritability of mental health problems the project will use multiple datasets with genetically informed research designs. This research program aims to identify the potential effects environmental factors such as school climate, peer relationships, and academic pressure. It will further explore the broader economic implications in terms of lost educational opportunities and reduced long-term productivity.<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Contact:<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="mailto:Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk" target="_self"><!-- -->Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk<!-- --></a><span>
</span><!-- -->Please do share!<!-- --><span>
</span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=economics&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>economics</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=mentalhealth&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>mentalhealth</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=education&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>education</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=research&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>research</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a></span>

<!-- -->
<span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Hello, all. Dr. Mallik will be joining as an assistant professor in the Department of Computer and Information Sciences (CIS) at Towson University - a research active public institution in Maryland, USA, in Fall-2024. Currently, there are two openings of fully funded PhD positions in his lab, with a research focus on energy-efficient infrastructure for sustainable AI.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Interested and highly motivated applicants can email him along with their CVs (two pages max, consisting of but not limited to their academic and test scores, github and google scholar links, research experience, publications, and technical skillset) at<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="mailto:amallik@charlotte.edu" target="_self"><!-- -->amallik@charlotte.edu<!-- --></a><!-- -->.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Recruited students are scheduled to start their doctoral study and research in Spring-2025. <span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Embarking on my<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205206566550044673"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>Journey at RPI!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Back in 2020, I started my journey in chemical engineering with the hope of entering the research field. As each day passed, my passion for this field grew stronger and more intense. Today, I am proud to share that I have successfully completed my bachelor's degree. But the journey doesn‚Äôt end here‚Äîit‚Äôs just the beginning of an exciting new chapter. I am excited to share that I have been offered fully funded PhD positions at both the University of Houston and<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/rensselaer-polytechnic-institute/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute<!-- --></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>(RPI). After much contemplation and excitement, I am overjoyed to continue my journey at RPI in the¬†Chemical and Biological Engineering Department.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->This achievement is not mine alone. They have been my backbone, providing the strength, encouragement, and wisdom I needed to reach this point.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->As I prepare to step into this new adventure, I am filled with gratitude and anticipation. The road ahead will undoubtedly be challenging, but I am ready to embrace it with open arms. </span><span>
</span><!-- -->Benefits<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Candidates can benefit from the program as follows:<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->- Scholarships: Various types, including those restricted to specific topics or reserved for students with degrees from international universities<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->- Additional Funding: Possible increases from additional financial resources such as NRRP, PON-RI, FSC, and POR Campania.<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->- Reserved Scholarships: Available for candidates with international protection status.<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->- Other Financial Aids: Potential funding from public and private entities.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>

<!-- -->
<span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Education and Mental Health: PhD Opportunity in Economics at Royal Holloway<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Fully funded PhD opportunity at¬†Royal Holloway, University of London¬†available from September<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->About three children in every classroom in the UK have a diagnosable mental health problem. Risk factors range from genetic, to psychological and environmental elements. This project will focus on the causal links between school environment and mental health. Due to the heritability of mental health problems the project will use multiple datasets with genetically informed research designs. This research program aims to identify the potential effects environmental factors such as school climate, peer relationships, and academic pressure. It will further explore the broader economic implications in terms of lost educational opportunities and reduced long-term productivity.<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Contact:<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="mailto:Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk" target="_self"><!-- -->Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk<!-- --></a><span>
</span><!-- -->Please do share!<!-- --><span>
</span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=economics&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>economics</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=mentalhealth&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>mentalhealth</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=education&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>education</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=research&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>research</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a></span>

<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Embarking on my<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205206566550044673"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>Journey at RPI!<!-- --><span>

<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Graduate Research Assistantship<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/uofnorthdakota/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->University of North Dakota<!-- --></span></span></a><span>

</div>, <div class="update-components-text relative update-components-update-v2__commentary" dir="ltr">
<!-- -->
<span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Education and Mental Health: PhD Opportunity in Economics at Royal Holloway<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Fully funded PhD opportunity at¬†Royal Holloway, University of London¬†available from September<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->About three children in every classroom in the UK have a diagnosable mental health problem. Risk factors range from genetic, to psychological and environmental elements. This project will focus on the causal links between school environment and mental health. Due to the heritability of mental health problems the project will use multiple datasets with genetically informed research designs. This research program aims to identify the potential effects environmental factors such as school climate, peer relationships, and academic pressure. It will further explore the broader economic implications in terms of lost educational opportunities and reduced long-term productivity.<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Contact:<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="mailto:Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk" target="_self"><!-- -->Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk<!-- --></a><span>
</span><!-- -->Please do share!<!-- --><span>
</span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=economics&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>economics</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=mentalhealth&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>mentalhealth</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=education&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>education</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=research&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>research</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a></span>

<!-- -->
<span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Embarking on my<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205206566550044673"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>Journey at RPI!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Back in 2020, I started my journey in chemical engineering with the hope of entering the research field. As each day passed, my passion for this field grew stronger and more intense. Today, I am proud to share that I have successfully completed my bachelor's degree. But the journey doesn‚Äôt end here‚Äîit‚Äôs just the beginning of an exciting new chapter. I am excited to share that I have been offered fully funded PhD positions at both the University of Houston and<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/rensselaer-polytechnic-institute/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute<!-- --></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>(RPI). After much contemplation and excitement, I am overjoyed to continue my journey at RPI in the¬†Chemical and Biological Engineering Department.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->This achievement is not mine alone. It is a testament to the unwavering support of my friends, teammates, and mentors of the<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/ACoAADc3OzYBltEbNn0H_J2UKmqV3YRzsI4IJLs" target="_self"><span><a class="ember-view" href="/in/thop-verse-89a2a321a/" id="ember625"><!-- -->THOP VERSE<!-- --></a></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>team, who stood by me through every high and low. They have been my backbone, providing the strength, encouragement, and wisdom I needed to reach this point.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->As I prepare to step into this new adventure, I am filled with gratitude and anticipation. The road ahead will undoubtedly be challenging, but I am ready to embrace it with open arms. Here‚Äôs to new beginnings, groundbreaking research, and making dreams a reality at RPI!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Thank you to everyone who has been a part of this incredible journey. Your belief in me has been my greatest motivation. Let‚Äôs continue to inspire and achieve together.<!-- --><span>

<!-- -->
<span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Education and Mental Health: PhD Opportunity in Economics at Royal Holloway<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Fully funded PhD opportunity at¬†Royal Holloway, University of London¬†available from September<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->About three children in every classroom in the UK have a diagnosable mental health problem. Risk factors range from genetic, to psychological and environmental elements. This project will focus on the causal links between school environment and mental health. Due to the heritability of mental health problems the project will use multiple datasets with genetically informed research designs. This research program aims to identify the potential effects environmental factors such as school climate, peer relationships, and academic pressure. It will further explore the broader economic implications in terms of lost educational opportunities and reduced long-term productivity.<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Contact:<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="mailto:Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk" target="_self"><!-- -->Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk<!-- --></a><span>
</span><!-- -->Please do share!<!-- --><span>
</span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=economics&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>economics</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=mentalhealth&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>mentalhealth</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=education&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>education</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=research&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>research</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a></span>

<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->University of Campania Luigi Vanvitelli Call for Applications: 40th Cycle Research Doctoral Courses by<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/universityofcampanialuigivanvitelli-/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->University of Campania "Luigi Vanvitelli"<span class="white-space-pre"> </span></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>

</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Benefits<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Candidates can benefit from the program as follows:<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->- Scholarships: Various types, including those restricted to specific topics or reserved for students with degrees from international universities<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->- Additional Funding: Possible increases from additional financial resources such as NRRP, PON-RI, FSC, and POR Campania.<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->- Reserved Scholarships: Available for candidates with international protection status.<!-- --><span>

<span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Education and Mental Health: PhD Opportunity in Economics at Royal Holloway<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Fully funded PhD opportunity at¬†Royal Holloway, University of London¬†available from September<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->About three children in every classroom in the UK have a diagnosable mental health problem. Risk factors range from genetic, to psychological and environmental elements. This project will focus on the causal links between school environment and mental health. Due to the heritability of mental health problems the project will use multiple datasets with genetically informed research designs. This research program aims to identify the potential effects environmental factors such as school climate, peer relationships, and academic pressure. It will further explore the broader economic implications in terms of lost educational opportunities and reduced long-term productivity.<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Contact:<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="mailto:Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk" target="_self"><!-- -->Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk<!-- --></a><span>
</span><!-- -->Please do share!<!-- --><span>
</span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=economics&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>economics</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=mentalhealth&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>mentalhealth</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=education&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>education</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=research&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>research</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a></span>

<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Embarking on my<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205206566550044673"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>Journey at RPI!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Back in 2020, I started my journey in chemical engineering with the hope of entering the research field. As each day passed, my passion for this field grew stronger and more intense. Today, I am proud to share that I have successfully completed my bachelor's degree. But the journey doesn‚Äôt end here‚Äîit‚Äôs just the beginning of an exciting new chapter. I am excited to share that I have been offered fully funded PhD positions at both the University of Houston and<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/rensselaer-polytechnic-institute/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute<!-- --></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>(RPI). <!-- -->
<span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Education and Mental Health: PhD Opportunity in Economics at Royal Holloway<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Fully funded PhD opportunity at¬†Royal Holloway, University of London¬†available from September<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->About three children in every classroom in the UK have a diagnosable mental health problem. Risk factors range from genetic, to psychological and environmental elements. This project will focus on the causal links between school environment and mental health. Due to the heritability of mental health problems the project will use multiple datasets with genetically informed research designs. This research program aims to identify the potential effects environmental factors such as school climate, peer relationships, and academic pressure. It will further explore the broader economic implications in terms of lost educational opportunities and reduced long-term productivity.<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Contact:<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="mailto:Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk" target="_self"><!-- -->Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk<!-- --></a><span>
</span><!-- -->Please do share!<!-- --><span>
</span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=economics&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>economics</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=mentalhealth&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>mentalhealth</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=education&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>education</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=research&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>research</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a></span>

</span><span>
</span><!-- -->I am excited and grateful to this initiative. I see myself in the PG school already.<!-- --><span>

<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Embarking on my<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205206566550044673"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>Journey at RPI!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Back in 2020, I started my journey in chemical engineering with the hope of entering the research field. As each day passed, my passion for this field grew stronger and more intense. Today, I am proud to share that I have successfully completed my bachelor's degree. But the journey doesn‚Äôt end here‚Äîit‚Äôs just the beginning of an exciting new chapter. I am excited to share that I have been offered fully funded PhD positions at both the University of Houston and<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/rensselaer-polytechnic-institute/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute<!-- --></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>(RPI). After much contemplation and excitement, I am overjoyed to continue my journey at RPI in the¬†Chemical and Biological Engineering Department.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->This achievement is not mine alone. They have been my backbone, providing the strength, encouragement, and wisdom I needed to reach this point.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->As I prepare to step into this new adventure, I am filled with gratitude and anticipation. The road ahead will undoubtedly be challenging, but I am ready to embrace it with open arms. <span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Education and Mental Health: PhD Opportunity in Economics at Royal Holloway<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Fully funded PhD opportunity at¬†Royal Holloway, University of London¬†available from September<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->About three children in every classroom in the UK have a diagnosable mental health problem. Risk factors range from genetic, to psychological and environmental elements. This project will focus on the causal links between school environment and mental health. Due to the heritability of mental health problems the project will use multiple datasets with genetically informed research designs. This research program aims to identify the potential effects environmental factors such as school climate, peer relationships, and academic pressure. It will further explore the broader economic implications in terms of lost educational opportunities and reduced long-term productivity.<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Contact:<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="mailto:Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk" target="_self"><!-- -->Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk<!-- --></a><span>
</span><!-- -->Please do share!<!-- --><span>
</span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=economics&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>economics</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=mentalhealth&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>mentalhealth</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=education&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>education</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=research&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>research</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a></span>

<!-- -->
<span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=iscolar2024&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205269990558588928"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>iScolar2024</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>Awardee<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Till now, I haven't lost my early hope, that wisdom is to be found in a book as easily as a fish can be found in the sea. I desire wisdom as keenly as Solomon, but this wisdom must be as genuine as my mother's tears!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->As an award-winning First-class graduate of the department of Chemistry, University of Ibadan, one of my goals for 2024/2025 is to pursue a postgraduate study in Computational Chemistry, preferably in the US or UK.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->However, one major requirement, which also offers a competitive advantage in getting a funded PhD opportunity in a renowned institution in the US is taking the GRE, which comes with a cost that I may not be able to afford.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Luckily, I came across<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/i-scholar-initiative/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->i-Scholar Initiative (iSI)<!-- --></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>on LinkedIn and I applied for their impeccable GRE scholarship offer.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->After submitting all the necessary documents required for the scholarship opportunity and after having an online interview with the sponsors of<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=isi&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205269990558588928"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>iSI</span></a><!-- -->, fortunately, I was selected as a beneficiary of the<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=ischolar2024&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205269990558588928"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>iScholar2024</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>scholarship award.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->I am excited and grateful to this initiative. I see myself in the PG school already.<!-- --><span>

<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->üî∞ ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêûùê¨ùê≠ùêûùêù ùê≠ùê® ùê†ùêûùê≠ ùêüùêÆùê•ùê•ùê≤ ùêüùêÆùêßùêùùêûùêù ùêèùê°ùêÉ ùê®ùêüùêüùêûùê´?<!-- --><span>

<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Embarking on my<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205206566550044673"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>Journey at RPI!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Back in 2020, I started my journey in chemical engineering with the hope of entering the research field. As each day passed, my passion for this field grew stronger and more intense. Today, I am proud to share that I have successfully completed my bachelor's degree. But the journey doesn‚Äôt end here‚Äîit‚Äôs just the beginning of an exciting new chapter. I am excited to share that I have been offered fully funded PhD positions at both the University of Houston and<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/rensselaer-polytechnic-institute/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute<!-- --></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>(RPI). After much contemplation and excitement, I am overjoyed to continue my journey at RPI in the¬†Chemical and Biological Engineering Department.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->This achievement is not mine alone. It is a testament to the unwavering support of my friends, teammates, and mentors of the<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/ACoAADc3OzYBltEbNn0H_J2UKmqV3YRzsI4IJLs" target="_self"><span><a class="ember-view" href="/in/thop-verse-89a2a321a/" id="ember625"><!-- -->THOP VERSE<!-- --></a></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>team, who stood by me through every high and low. They have been my backbone, providing the strength, encouragement, and wisdom I needed to reach this point.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->As I prepare to step into this new adventure, I am filled with gratitude and anticipation. The road ahead will undoubtedly be challenging, but I am ready to embrace it with open arms. Here‚Äôs to new beginnings, groundbreaking research, and making dreams a reality at RPI!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>

              position_text:  University of North Dakota

              result    result    result    result    result    result
              result: <div class="update-components-text relative update-components-update-v2__commentary" dir="ltr">
<!-- -->
<span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Education and Mental Health: PhD Opportunity in Economics at Royal Holloway<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Fully funded PhD opportunity at¬†Royal Holloway, University of London¬†available from September<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->About three children in every classroom in the UK have a diagnosable mental health problem. Risk factors range from genetic, to psychological and environmental elements. This project will focus on the causal links between school environment and mental health. Due to the heritability of mental health problems the project will use multiple datasets with genetically informed research designs. This research program aims to identify the potential effects environmental factors such as school climate, peer relationships, and academic pressure. It will further explore the broader economic implications in terms of lost educational opportunities and reduced long-term productivity.<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Contact:<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="mailto:Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk" target="_self"><!-- -->Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk<!-- --></a><span>
</span><!-- -->Please do share!<!-- --><span>
</span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=economics&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>economics</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=mentalhealth&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>mentalhealth</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=education&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>education</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=research&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>research</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a></span>

</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Successful candidates will have the chance to contribute to cutting-edge research on the design and analysis of networked control systems integrating concepts from distributed optimization, networked control theory, machine learning, and privacy preservation, with potential applications in various domains such as smart grids, cyber-physical systems, Internet of Things, and cooperative robotics.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->The positions are full-time and will commence in September 2024.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>

<span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Education and Mental Health: PhD Opportunity in Economics at Royal Holloway<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Fully funded PhD opportunity at¬†Royal Holloway, University of London¬†available from September<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->About three children in every classroom in the UK have a diagnosable mental health problem. Risk factors range from genetic, to psychological and environmental elements. This project will focus on the causal links between school environment and mental health. Due to the heritability of mental health problems the project will use multiple datasets with genetically informed research designs. This research program aims to identify the potential effects environmental factors such as school climate, peer relationships, and academic pressure. It will further explore the broader economic implications in terms of lost educational opportunities and reduced long-term productivity.<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Contact:<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="mailto:Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk" target="_self"><!-- -->Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk<!-- --></a><span>
</span><!-- -->Please do share!<!-- --><span>
</span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=economics&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>economics</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=mentalhealth&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>mentalhealth</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=education&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>education</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=research&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>research</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a></span>

<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Embarking on my<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205206566550044673"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>Journey at RPI!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Back in 2020, I started my journey in chemical engineering with the hope of entering the research field. As each day passed, my passion for this field grew stronger and more intense. Today, I am proud to share that I have successfully completed my bachelor's degree. But the journey doesn‚Äôt end here‚Äîit‚Äôs just the beginning of an exciting new chapter. I am excited to share that I have been offered fully funded PhD positions at both the University of Houston and<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/rensselaer-polytechnic-institute/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute<!-- --></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>(RPI). <!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->University of Campania Luigi Vanvitelli Call for Applications: 40th Cycle Research Doctoral Courses by<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/universityofcampanialuigivanvitelli-/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->University of Campania "Luigi Vanvitelli"<span class="white-space-pre"> </span></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>

</span><span>
</span><!-- -->- Scholarships: Various types, including those restricted to specific topics or reserved for students with degrees from international universities<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->- Additional Funding: Possible increases from additional financial resources such as NRRP, PON-RI, FSC, and POR Campania.<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->- Reserved Scholarships: Available for candidates with international protection status.<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->- Other Financial Aids: Potential funding from public and private entities.<!-- --><span>

<!-- -->
<span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Education and Mental Health: PhD Opportunity in Economics at Royal Holloway<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Fully funded PhD opportunity at¬†Royal Holloway, University of London¬†available from September<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->About three children in every classroom in the UK have a diagnosable mental health problem. Risk factors range from genetic, to psychological and environmental elements. This project will focus on the causal links between school environment and mental health. Due to the heritability of mental health problems the project will use multiple datasets with genetically informed research designs. This research program aims to identify the potential effects environmental factors such as school climate, peer relationships, and academic pressure. It will further explore the broader economic implications in terms of lost educational opportunities and reduced long-term productivity.<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Contact:<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="mailto:Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk" target="_self"><!-- -->Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk<!-- --></a><span>
</span><!-- -->Please do share!<!-- --><span>
</span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=economics&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>economics</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=mentalhealth&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>mentalhealth</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=education&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>education</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=research&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>research</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a></span>

</span><span>
</span><!-- -->As an award-winning First-class graduate of the department of Chemistry, University of Ibadan, one of my goals for 2024/2025 is to pursue a postgraduate study in Computational Chemistry, preferably in the US or UK.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->However, one major requirement, which also offers a competitive advantage in getting a funded PhD opportunity in a renowned institution in the US is taking the GRE, which comes with a cost that I may not be able to afford.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Luckily, I came across<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/i-scholar-initiative/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->i-Scholar Initiative (iSI)<!-- --></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>on LinkedIn and I applied for their impeccable GRE scholarship offer.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->After submitting all the necessary documents required for the scholarship opportunity and after having an online interview with the sponsors of<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=isi&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205269990558588928"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>iSI</span></a><!-- -->, fortunately, I was selected as a beneficiary of the<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=ischolar2024&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205269990558588928"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>iScholar2024</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>scholarship award.<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->I am excited and grateful to this initiative. I see myself in the PG school already.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Regards,<!-- --><span>

</span>
</div>, <div class="update-components-text relative update-components-update-v2__commentary" dir="ltr">
<!-- -->
<span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Embarking on my<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205206566550044673"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>Journey at RPI!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Back in 2020, I started my journey in chemical engineering with the hope of entering the research field. As each day passed, my passion for this field grew stronger and more intense. Today, I am proud to share that I have successfully completed my bachelor's degree. But the journey doesn‚Äôt end here‚Äîit‚Äôs just the beginning of an exciting new chapter. I am excited to share that I have been offered fully funded PhD positions at both the University of Houston and<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/rensselaer-polytechnic-institute/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute<!-- --></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>(RPI). After much contemplation and excitement, I am overjoyed to continue my journey at RPI in the¬†Chemical and Biological Engineering Department.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->This achievement is not mine alone. It is a testament to the unwavering support of my friends, teammates, and mentors of the<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/ACoAADc3OzYBltEbNn0H_J2UKmqV3YRzsI4IJLs" target="_self"><span><a class="ember-view" href="/in/thop-verse-89a2a321a/" id="ember625"><!-- -->THOP VERSE<!-- --></a></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>team, who stood by me through every high and low. They have been my backbone, providing the strength, encouragement, and wisdom I needed to reach this point.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->As I prepare to step into this new adventure, I am filled with gratitude and anticipation. The road ahead will undoubtedly be challenging, but I am ready to embrace it with open arms. Here‚Äôs to new beginnings, groundbreaking research, and making dreams a reality at RPI!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Thank you to everyone who has been a part of this incredible journey. Your belief in me has been my greatest motivation. Let‚Äôs continue to inspire and achieve together.<!-- --><span>

<span class="break-words tvm-parent-container">
<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Education and Mental Health: PhD Opportunity in Economics at Royal Holloway<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Fully funded PhD opportunity at¬†Royal Holloway, University of London¬†available from September<!-- --><span>
</span><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->About three children in every classroom in the UK have a diagnosable mental health problem. Risk factors range from genetic, to psychological and environmental elements. This project will focus on the causal links between school environment and mental health. Due to the heritability of mental health problems the project will use multiple datasets with genetically informed research designs. This research program aims to identify the potential effects environmental factors such as school climate, peer relationships, and academic pressure. It will further explore the broader economic implications in terms of lost educational opportunities and reduced long-term productivity.<!-- --><span>
</span><!-- -->Contact:<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="mailto:Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk" target="_self"><!-- -->Dan.Anderberg@rhul.ac.uk<!-- --></a><span>
</span><!-- -->Please do share!<!-- --><span>
</span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=economics&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>economics</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=mentalhealth&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>mentalhealth</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=education&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>education</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=research&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>research</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span><!-- --><!-- --><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205158547305758720"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a></span>

<!-- --> <span dir="ltr"><!-- -->Embarking on my<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=phd&amp;highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A7205206566550044673"><span class="visually-hidden">hashtag</span><span><span aria-hidden="true">#</span>PhD</span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>Journey at RPI!<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->Back in 2020, I started my journey in chemical engineering with the hope of entering the research field. As each day passed, my passion for this field grew stronger and more intense. Today, I am proud to share that I have successfully completed my bachelor's degree. But the journey doesn‚Äôt end here‚Äîit‚Äôs just the beginning of an exciting new chapter. I am excited to share that I have been offered fully funded PhD positions at both the University of Houston and<span class="white-space-pre"> </span><a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/rensselaer-polytechnic-institute/" target="_self"><span><span><!-- -->Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute<!-- --></span></span></a><span class="white-space-pre"> </span>(RPI). They have been my backbone, providing the strength, encouragement, and wisdom I needed to reach this point.<!-- --><span>
</span><span>
</span><!-- -->As I prepare to step into this new adventure, I am filled with gratitude and anticipation. The road ahead will undoubtedly be challenging, but I am ready to embrace it with open arms.
